query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Parea dinanzi a me con l’ali aperte 2 la bella image che nel dolce frui 3 liete facevan l’anime conserte;
query.error: **English:** 1 There appeared before me with open wings 2 the beautiful image that in the sweet fruits 3 made the gathered souls joyful;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 parea ciascuna rubinetto in cui 5 raggio di sole ardesse sì acceso, 6 che ne’ miei occhi rifrangesse lui.
query.error: **English:** 4 each one seemed like a ruby in which 5 a ray of the sun burned so brightly 6 that it reflected itself in my eyes.
query.result: 4 æghwylc wæs swa rubine gelic 5 ðe sunnan leoma swa readne onlihte, 6 ðæt hit on minum gesihðe scineð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 E quel che mi convien ritrar testeso, 8 non portò voce mai, né scrisse incostro, 9 né fu per fantasia già mai compreso;
query.error: **English:** 7 And that which it behooves me to relate now, 8 no voice ever bore, nor ink wrote, 9 nor was it ever comprehended by fantasy;
query.result: 7 And ðæt ðe ic sceal secgan ðe ðu nu gehyrð, 8 ðæt ne bær næfre nænig fugel on flyhte, 9 ne on bēc ne on breoste ne on blæce wrat,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 ch’io vidi e anche udi’ parlar lo rostro, 11 e sonar ne la voce e «io» e «mio», 12 quand’ era nel concetto e ‘noi’ e ‘nostro’.
query.error: **English:** 10 for I saw and also heard the beak speak, 11 and sound in the voice both “I” and “my”, 12 when it was in the thought both “we” and “our”.
query.result: 10 ac ic ðæt geseah ðurh ðæs Hælendes gæst, 11 and ðurh ðæs Hælendes word ðæt ic ðær gehyrde, 12 ða ða ic wæs on ðam wlite ðe ðu nu on locige.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 e in terra lasciai la mia memoria 17 sì fatta, che le genti lì malvage 18 commendan lei, ma non seguon la storia».
query.error: **English:** 16 and on earth I left my memory 17 such that the wicked people there 18 praise it, but do not follow its story."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Così un sol calor di molte brage 20 si fa sentir, come di molti amori 21 usciva solo un suon di quella image.
query.error: **English:** 19 Thus a single heat from many coals 20 makes itself felt, as from many loves 21 there came forth a single sound from that image.
query.result: 19 Swa an æghwylc hætu of manegum glede 20 bið afunden, swa of manegum lufe 21 com an æghwylc stefn of ðære anlicnesse.

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 solvetemi, spirando, il gran digiuno 26 che lungamente m’ha tenuto in fame, 27 non trovandoli in terra cibo alcuno.
query.error: **English:** 25 satisfy, by your blowing, the great hunger 26 that has long kept me famished, 27 not finding any food on earth."
query.result: 25 alysað me, ðurh ðinne stenc, ðone miclan hungor 26 ðe mec lange hwile ðurstlede, 27 ða ic on eorðan ænigne mete ne funde."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Ben so io che, se ’n cielo altro reame 29 la divina giustizia fa suo specchio, 30 che ’l vostro non l’apprende con velame.
query.error: **English:** 28 Well I know that if in heaven another kingdom 29 divine justice makes its mirror, 30 that yours does not apprehend it with a veil.
query.result: 28 Wel ic wat ðæt, gif on heofonum oðer rice 29 ðæt godcunde riht his spegil geworhte, 30 ðæt ðin hit ne ongit mid wrigelsum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Sapete come attento io m’apparecchio 32 ad ascoltar; sapete qual è quello 33 dubbio che m’è digiun cotanto vecchio».
query.error: **English:** 31 You know how attentive I prepare myself 32 to listen; you know what that doubt is 33 that has been fasting me for so long.
query.result: 31 Ge witon hu geornlice ic me gearcige 32 to gehyranne; ge witon hwæt se ðeofa is 33 ðe me fæsteð swiðe lange.

query.prompt:

49 e quinci appar ch’ogne minor natura 50 è corto recettacolo a quel bene 51 che non ha fine e sé con sé misura.

55 non pò da sua natura esser possente 56 tanto, che suo principio discerna 57 molto di là da quel che l’è parvente.

query.prompt:

61 che, ben che da la proda veggia il fondo, 62 in pelago nol vede; e nondimeno 63 èli, ma cela lui l’esser profondo.
query.error: **English:** 61 for, although from the shore it sees the bottom, 62 it does not see it in the open sea; and yet 63 it is there, but its profound being conceals it.
query.result: 61 ðeáh ðe hit of ðære strande ðone grund geseo, 62 on ðam pelage hit ne gesihð; and ðeahhwæðere 63 he is, ac him ðæt deope wesen digleð.

query.prompt:

76 Muore non battezzato e sanza fede: 77 ov’ è questa giustizia che ’l condanna? 78 ov’ è la colpa sua, se ei non crede?”.

query.result: 76 Heo deð unge-fullod and unge-leafa: 77 hwær is ðæt riht ðe hine forðemet? 78 hwær is his gylt, gif he ne gelyfð?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Or tu chi se’, che vuo’ sedere a scranna, 80 per giudicar di lungi mille miglia 81 con la veduta corta d’una spanna?

query.result: 79 Nu ðu ðe eart, ðe wylt on scranne sittan, 80 ðe ðus feorran ðomasand mila 81 mid ðære gesyhðe ðe is spanne lang?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Certo a colui che meco s’assottiglia, 83 se la Scrittura sovra voi non fosse, 84 da dubitar sarebbe a maraviglia.
query.error: **English:** 82 Certainly for him who agrees with me, 83 if Scripture were not above you, 84 it would be a marvel to doubt.
query.result: 82 Soðlice ðam ðe mid me swiðe smeað, 83 gif ðæt gewrit ofer eow nære, 84 ðonne wære wundor ðe man mihte tweogan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 Oh terreni animali! oh menti grosse! 86 La prima volontà, ch’è da sé buona, 87 da sé, ch’è sommo ben, mai non si mosse.
query.error: **English:** 85 Oh earthly creatures! Oh dull minds! 86 The first will, which is good in itself, 87 never moved from itself, which is the highest good.
query.result: 85 Eala ðu eorðlice nieten! Eala ðu ðunwende mod! 86 Se forma willa, ðe is from him sylfum god, 87 ne wearð næfre afyrred fram him sylfum, ðe is ðæt hehste god.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Cotanto è giusto quanto a lei consuona: 89 nullo creato bene a sé la tira, 90 ma essa, radïando, lui cagiona».

query.result: 88 Swa hit is riht swa hit hire gelicode: 89 nan gesceaft god hire to ne teode, 90 ac heo, scinende, hit geworhte.

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Ma vedi: molti gridan “Cristo, Cristo!”, 107 che saranno in giudicio assai men prope 108 a lui, che tal che non conosce Cristo;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 e tai Cristian dannerà l’Etïòpe, 110 quando si partiranno i due collegi, 111 l’uno in etterno ricco e l’altro inòpe.
query.error: **English:** 109 and such Christians the Ethiopian will condemn, 110 when the two companies depart, 111 one eternally rich and the other destitute.
query.result: 109 and swylce Cristene ðone Moriane demað, 110 ðonne ða twegen heapas sceolon toslitan, 111 oder on ecnesse earm and oder earfeþe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Che poran dir li Perse a’ vostri regi, 113 come vedranno quel volume aperto 114 nel qual si scrivon tutti suoi dispregi?
query.error: **English:** 112 What will the Persians say to your kings, 113 when they see that volume opened 114 in which all their disgraces are written?
query.result: 112 Hwat secgað ða Persas to eowrum cyningum, 113 ðonne hi geseoð ðæt boc open 114 on ðære sind awritene ealle heora yrmða?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 Lì si vedrà, tra l’opere d’Alberto, 116 quella che tosto moverà la penna, 117 per che ’l regno di Praga fia diserto.
query.error: **English:** 115 There will be seen, among the works of Albert, 116 that which will soon move the pen, 117 because of which the kingdom of Prague will be deserted.
query.result: 115 Þær bið gesewen, betwux ðara weorca Ælberhtes, 116 ðæt ðe hraðe aweceð ða penne, 117 ðurh ðæt ðæs cynerīce Pragæ bið awest.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Lì si vedrà il duol che sovra Senna 119 induce, falseggiando la moneta, 120 quel che morrà di colpo di cotenna.
query.error: **English:** 118 There will be seen the grief that over Seine 119 false coining brings, and then he dies 120 by sudden blow that causes bloody wound.
query.result: 118 Þær mon mæg geseon ðone dolg ðe ofer Sæne 119 awecð, ðurh ðæs feos feorgunge, 120 se ðe ðurh cotenan dolg sceal sweltan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Lì si vedrà la superbia ch’asseta, 122 che fa lo Scotto e l’Inghilese folle, 123 sì che non può soffrir dentro a sua meta.
query.error: **English:** 121 There shall be seen the pride that lays siege, 122 that makes the Scot and the Englishman mad, 123 so that it cannot suffer within its bounds.
query.result: 121 Þær mon mæg geseon ða ofermodignesse ðe asæteð, 122 ðe ðone Scottan and ðone Engliscan gedæð dysige, 123 swa ðæt he ne mæg þolian binnan his gemærum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Vedrassi la lussuria e ’l viver molle 125 di quel di Spagna e di quel di Boemme, 126 che mai valor non conobbe né volle.
query.error: **English:** 124 You will see the lust and the soft living 125 of the king of Spain and the king of Bohemia, 126 who never knew or desired valor.
query.result: 124 ðu gesihst ðære giernesse and ðæt softe lif 125 ðæs cyninges of Spanie and ðæs of Beme, 126 ðe næfre cræft ne cuðon ne woldon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Vedrassi al Ciotto di Ierusalemme 128 segnata con un i la sua bontate, 129 quando ’l contrario segnerà un emme.
query.error: **English:** 127 You will see at the Hill of Jerusalem 128 his goodness marked with an i, 129 when the opposite will mark an m.
query.result: 127 Þu gesihst æt ðam Ciotte on Ierusalem 128 getacnod mid anum i his godcundnysse, 129 ðonne ðæt ongean gesyneð an m.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Vedrassi l’avarizia e la viltate 131 di quei che guarda l’isola del foco, 132 ove Anchise finì la lunga etate;
query.error: **English:** 130 You will see the avarice and the baseness 131 of those who guard the island of fire, 132 where Anchises ended his long life;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 e a dare ad intender quanto è poco, 134 la sua scrittura fian lettere mozze, 135 che noteranno molto in parvo loco.
query.error: **English:** 133 and to make you understand how little it is worth, 134 his writing will be broken letters, 135 which will signify much in a small space.
query.result: 133 and ðæt ðu mæge ongitan hu lyt ðæt is weorð, 134 ðonne beoð ða his gewritu brocene stafas, 135 ðe mænige ðing getacniað on lytlum stowe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 E parranno a ciascun l’opere sozze 137 del barba e del fratel, che tanto egregia 138 nazione e due corone han fatte bozze.
query.error: **English:** 136 And the vile deeds of the uncle and the brother 137 will appear to each one, who have made so noble 138 a nation and two crowns leprous.
query.result: 136 And ðæs eames and ðæs broðor ða wyrrestan dæda 137 æteowed beoð æghwylcum men, ða ðe ða æðelan 138 þeode and ða twa corðan to lyðre gewæmman.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 E quel di Portogallo e di Norvegia 140 lì si conosceranno, e quel di Rascia 141 che male ha visto il conio di Vinegia.
query.error: **English:** 139 And he of Portugal and of Norway 140 there they will be known, and he of Rascia 141 who has seen the coinage of Venice with ill favor.
query.result: 139 And se ðæs of Portingale and of Norweie 140 ðær beoð icnowen, and se of Rascie 141 ðe ðæs of Wenisces mynet misliche iseah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 Oh beata Ungheria, se non si lascia 143 più malmenare! e beata Navarra, 144 se s’armasse del monte che la fascia!
query.error: **English:** 142 Oh blessed Hungary, if it does not allow itself 143 to be mistreated any more! And blessed Navarre, 144 if it would arm itself with the mountain that surrounds it!
query.result: 142 Eala eadig Ungare, gif heo ne læt 143 leng malmenne! and eadig Nafarre, 144 gif heo hire bewæpnode ðæs mundes ðe heo befeho!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
145 E creder de’ ciascun che già, per arra 146 di questo, Niccosïa e Famagosta 147 per la lor bestia si lamenti e garra,

query.result: 145 And wenan mæg æghwylc ðæt nu ðurh ðis, 146 Nicosa and Famagosta 147 for heora deore gedreorig sind and geomriað,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
148 che dal fianco de l’altre non si scosta».
query.error: **English:** 148 which does not depart from the flank of the others.
query.result: 148 ðe of sidan ðara oðra ne awendað.
